_aChangeLog.text: Corrected the hostage's movement through a small ladder (Tunnel-SideYard)
Improved bot's movement through the oar door (LoadingDock-StorageRoom)
Improved bot's movement through the window (Apartments-Overpass)

_sText:
Counter-Strike: Source : Bot's Navigation Mesh for the map CS_LAUNDRY

Nav Creator: Meurglis3, Release Date: August 22 2016

Here is the Navigation Mesh for grandiose assault-themed map cs_laundry by Spence / RabidMonkey (released February 2012). It's a totally created from scratch and manually optimized (hand-tuned) .nav-file because in original map author's archive was included slightly edited and almost unplayable auto-gen.

More than 80% of all areas were created manually because during an auto-generation processing the majority of them were constructed incorrectly (especially door passes and ladder marches).

Well... bots have opportunity to use all walkable ways and they surely move according to all areas of the map. Though this very complex map is a real champion by quantity of oar doors and crossing narrow passes it doesn't confuse them!  :-)

Also this Navigation Mesh is fully Place Painted (more detailed and thematically pertinently than in original mapauthor's file).

NOTE: For possibility of comparison and in-game testing the original navigation file by map author available to downloading with the same map.

Play and Enjoy! Also all your responses and remarks are always welcomed ;-)

Credits and Gratitudes:  Spence (for fine designed and high detailed downtown-styled map).

Additional Gratitudes:  BarnDoor (for perfect playable navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps),  Chizbone (for informative and clever article BOT_BRAINED and a set of excellent navigation meshes),  CoCoNUT (for fine hand-tuned navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps),  Valve Developer Community (for learning articles by Navigation Meshes and Navigation Mesh Commands).

No "tickee" no laundry! :-)
